justification: “Participants completed a variant of the Skewed Gambling Task… Skew bias scores were calculated… reflecting how much more an individual chose positively, compared to negatively, skewed gambles.”
construct: skew bias / preference for skewed gambles

justification: “Individuals who were 55 or older completed the Short Blessed Test (SBT; Katzman et al., 1983) phone screening before being invited to participate.”
“…were then given the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA; Nasreddine et al., 2005) at the time of assessment. Individuals with scores of 25 or below on the MoCA were excluded…”
“Participants completed… the Emotion Regulation Questionnaire (ERQ; Gross & John, 2003).”
“Participants completed… the Affect Valuation Index (AVI; Tsai, Knutson, & Fung, 2006).”
“Participants completed… subjective graph literacy (Garcia-Retamero et al., 2016).”
“Participants completed… objective graph literacy (Okan et al., 2019).”
“Participants also completed the Cognition Battery of the NIH Toolbox (Weintraub et al., 2013) that tested executive function, processing speed, language, working memory, and episodic memory.”
construct: cognitive abilities (executive function, processing speed, language, working memory, episodic memory)
